languages.custom: Thieves' cant plus any two languages

description.value: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Obmi makes three melee attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage, and the target must make a [[/save con 15 format=long]], taking [[/damage 7d6 type=poison average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d8 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage, and the target must make a [[/save con 15 format=long]], taking [[/damage 7d6 type=poison average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Assassinate. During his first turn, Obmi has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn’t taken a turn. Any hit Obmi scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Evasion. If Obmi is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw to take only half damage, Obmi instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if he fails.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Sneak Attack. Once per turn, Obmi deals an extra [[/damage 4d6 average=true]] damage when he hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of his that isn’t &Reference[incapacitated]{incapacitated} and Obmi doesn’t have disadvantage on the attack roll.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
